page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Long Lane lies within a roughly triangular area of rural countryside, rising gently to the north and west, bounded by Derby, Ashbourne and Uttoxeter and aptly described as "Derbyshire's Middle West. Containing no focal point, this is a countryside of scattered farms, small villages and hamlets, coppice plantations and hedgerow trees with everywhere intensive arable and pastoral agriculture. The steady decline in population since the Middle Ages is only partially arrested in selected villages by limited residential development this century. Agricultural holdings have become fewer but larger with the abandonment of surplus farm buildings to other uses or to dereliction. As in the rest of the British Isles, agricultural output has soared in recent years.
